title: language_test_3_4
prompt:
What is the best way to complete blank 4?

When power is restored, the maintenance staff will ![dropdown:Drop_Down_695_76] check pipes for leaks from possible freeze damage.
feedback: The correct answer is "restore water flow and then." The sentence should read: “When power is restored, the maintenance staff will restore water flow and then check pipes for leaks from possible freeze damage.” Using a comma is incorrect because “then check pipes for leaks from possible freeze damage” is a part of the compound predicate. It’s not a sentence that can stand on its own. For the same reason, it’s incorrect to make it a separate sentence! A semicolon before the word “and” is always incorrect. The correct answer is to use no punctuation and join the two parts of the predicate with the word “and.”
